definition: interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Hakka clan of the esteem by which Street play most vividly.
sentences.chinese: 長汀的和田鎮有一條古色古香的客家宗祠街。

sentences.english: These classic pieces of furniture imitating ancient style almost look genuine.
sentences.chinese: 古色古香的仿古傢俱，簡直可以亂真。

sentences.english: The pavilions beside the lake have an air of great antiquity.
sentences.chinese: 湖邊的亭閣被修葺得古色古香。

sentences.english: I am in a small shop in Xitang.
sentences.chinese: 我在一家西塘的小商店裏，古色古香。

sentences.english: These imitations of Qing-dynasty-style buildings are of quiet elegance and classic beauty.
sentences.chinese: 這些仿清建築，幽雅別緻，古色古香。

sentences.english: The millet paste dyes the cloth, antique.

definition: simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
in picturesque disorder (idiom); irregular arrangement with charming effect
see 亭臺樓閣|亭台楼阁[ting2 tai2 lou2 ge2]
pseudo-classical/modeled on antique/in the old style
patchwork of waterways, esp. in Jiangsu
implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
